required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of the present pilot study is to determine the feasibility of using MRI and MRE to evaluate the liver in infants with suspected liver disease.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Magnetic resonance elastography on infants with suspected liver disease

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of MRE to Provide Evaluable Images That Illustrate the Stiffness of Liver Parenchyma in an Infant Population
primary_outcome.description: To determine the feasibility of MRE to provide evaluable images that illustrate the stiffness of liver parenchyma in an infant population.

arm_group.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device

intervention.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants < 6 months of age
- Known liver disease based (liver enzymes, bilirubin, and/or GGT at least twice the upper limit of normal for age)
- Parental/LAR permission obtained
Exclusion Criteria:
- Standard MRI exclusion criteria as set forth by the CCHMC Division of Radiology
- Severe coagulopathy (INR > 3 or platelets <50,000)

group.title: MRI With MRE
group.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device MRI with MRE: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device

baseline.population: Study closed due to low enrollment. The two participants that were enrolled did not have their data analyzed.

group.title: MRI With MRE
group.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device MRI with MRE: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Feasibility of MRE to Provide Evaluable Images That Illustrate the Stiffness of Liver Parenchyma in an Infant Population
outcome.description: To determine the feasibility of MRE to provide evaluable images that illustrate the stiffness of liver parenchyma in an infant population.
outcome.population: There were too few eligible candidates that clinically would benefit enough to justify the potential risk of being removed from the unit and undergoing MRE in a Radiology department scanner, so the study was terminated with only 2 patients enrolled.

group.title: MRI With MRE

measure.title: Feasibility of MRE to Provide Evaluable Images That Illustrate the Stiffness of Liver Parenchyma in an Infant Population
measure.description: To determine the feasibility of MRE to provide evaluable images that illustrate the stiffness of liver parenchyma in an infant population.
measure.population: There were too few eligible candidates that clinically would benefit enough to justify the potential risk of being removed from the unit and undergoing MRE in a Radiology department scanner, so the study was terminated with only 2 patients enrolled.

group.title: MRI With MRE
group.description: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device MRI with MRE: Magnetic Resonance Imaging with Magnetic Resonance Elastography using the GE MR Touch device

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Due to difficulty with finding neonates who met the inclusion/exclusion criteria who were safe to leave the NICU and go to the Radiology department, the study was terminated and data from the 2 participants enrolled was not analyzed.
